response.original_title: Felled: A Documentary Film About Giving New Life to Fallen Urban Trees.
response.overview: Felled is a story about finding worth and beauty in something most consider to be trash. The film chronicles the journey of an urban pine tree downed by a summer storm and saved from the landfill by two woodworkers who give the tree new meaning as a family dinner table. Through interviews with industry experts, sawyers, arborists, artists, and woodworkers, including both Norm Abram and Nick Offerman, the film highlights the growing urban lumber movement and explores themes of waste, craftsmanship, and redemption.
response.title: Felled: A Documentary Film About Giving New Life to Fallen Urban Trees.
